subject: Re: FW: Wording for google searches
preview: Hi Guys,  Just confirming the goals have been set up on Google Analytics  Many thanks  Alban

full_threads.body:
Hi Guys,

Just confirming the goals have been set up on Google Analytics

Many thanks

Alban

Thanks Heath. This is perfect.
We will set this up.

Alban Guillemot

Hi Alban, 

Ok great, here are the 2 pages: 

Sign up page
- https://huntleyandco.com.au/sign-up/thank-you/

Quote submission and payment:
-https://huntleyandco.com.au/my-account/?thankyou=true&key=aXlOQytKbkV3TW1uY3pMUCs2RVd0Zz09
-https://huntleyandco.com.au/my-account/?thankyou=true
(Please note, this URL has a token at the end of it e.g. &key=xxxxxxxxx....., this will need to be filtered out ideally?) 

Let me know if you need anything else for this task?

@heath 

Sign up page
- https://huntleyandco.com.au/sign-up/thank-you/

For this one RFP submit:
-https://huntleyandco.com.au/my-account/?thankyou=true&key=aXlOQytKbkV3TW1uY3pMUCs2RVd0Zz09
-https://huntleyandco.com.au/my-account/?thankyou=true
@joel please continue with this task as below. Cheers

Hi Heath,

Thanks. This is perfect. Please feel free to share the URLs and we can set these up.

Many thanks

Alban Guillemot

Hi Alban, 

The confirmation messages are currently displayed in an Ajax format, i.e. there is no page reload to a unique URL. We can however code these in. 

  • The signup page is straight forward. 
  • The quote and payment submission is done during the same session (it's a 2 part form), so these would have to be the same goal. I.e. in order for them to submit their quote, we are actually storing an encrypted copy of their credit card in Stripe for Amy to process at some point in the future, prior to delivery. 
If we setup two pages for the above two goals, will that work ok for you?

Hi Heath, I hope you had a great weekend. Thanks for granting access it works fine. We are trying to set up Goals in Google Analytics to measure the effectiveness of the online marketing activities and I have a few questions for you:
  • Could you please confirm the "thank you" page for the Sign up, basically the page that comes up when someone successfully sign up
  • Could you please confirm the "thank you" page for a quote, basically the page that comes up when someone successfully submitted a quote
  • Could you please confirm the "thank you" page for a paid order, basically the page than comes up when someone successfully pay for an order.
I hope this all makes sense. Any questions, please feel free to let me know. Many thanks Alban Guillemot Director of Digital Phone: 02 8006 5096 Mobile: 0413 351 667 Skype: fullsteam_consulting Email: alban@fullsteamconsulting.com.au Address: Studio 3, Lvl 1, 35 Buckingham Street, NSW, 2010 Web:http://www.fullsteamconsulting.com.au/

Hi Amy, 

Sure, I actually added alban@fullsteamconsulting.com.au, I have now also added mcc@fullsteamconsulting.com.au

Hello,

Please see below. Are you able to provide access please?

Kind Regards
Amy Smith

Many thanks


Alban

Ok. Thank you.

Would it be possible to provide me an example of this (below) please so I can get an idea of what you are after. Perhaps something Advantage has used. Thank you.
Headline 1: 30 characters
Headline 2: 30 characters
Headline 3: 30 characters
Description line 1: 90 characters
Description line 2: 90 characters


Kind Regards

Hi Amy,

No worries.
USP: Unique selling proposition. Essentially what makes your business stand out against your competitors.


Many thanks


Alban

On 5 Jun 2019, at 3:35 pm, Alban Guillemot <alban@fullsteamconsulting.com.au> wrote:

Hi Amy,


Thanks. To answer your questions:


The ad copy will differ slightly depending on search terms. I guess what we are more after is the USP and the message you want to convey.

Character limits are as follows:

Headline 1: 30 characters
Headline 2: 30 characters
Headline 3: 30 characters
Description line 1: 90 characters
Description line 2: 90 characters

note: the character limit includes space and punctuation

I hope this makes sense. Any questions please let me know

Many thanks

Alban

On Tue, Jun 4, 2019 at 9:47 PM Amy Smith <amy@huntleyandco.com.au> wrote:
HI Alban,

Thanks for your time on the phone this afternoon.

Dan sent me the attached APS Text Ads May. I presume that this is the wording you mentioned earlier? Can you please confirm if different wording will appear depending on what terms are searched. For example if someone searches "DIY Styling" We would talk about Huntley in a different way to of they searched "Event Hire"? The wording that I am referring to is the grey font in the attached add for Valiant (I'm not sure what the technical name is for this wording is, sorry!).

If this is the case, can you please let me know the terms that we will be targeting and I will write the copy. Can you please also let me know how many characters we should aim for and if you have any suggestions of words that should be included.

Thank you for your help.

Kind Regards
Amy Smith

AMY SMITH
CEO - HUNTLEY + CO
